intro: Ctenitis leonii, commonly known as the Leon's tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the wet tropical forests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 10 meters in optimal conditions. Its rhizome is thick and fibrous, supporting the plant's structure and facilitating nutrient absorption. Ctenitis leonii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
